abstract: Hampton Court Palace near London holds its first Roman Catholic Service in 450 years; palace had ceased holding Catholic services in 1530, when King Henry VIII ended his relationship with church so he could divorce his wife and marry mistress Anne Boleyn; service celebrates palace's 500th anniversary and comes amid reconciliation attempts between Roman Catholic Church and Church of England.
lead_paragraph: Hampton Court Palace hosted a vespers service in a symbol of the growing reconciliation between the Roman Catholic Church and the Church of England.

headline.main: Palace of Henry VIII Holds First Catholic Service in Nearly 500 Years
headline.print_headline: Reconciliation in a Palace of Henry VIII

snippet: Hampton Court Palace hosted a vespers service in a symbol of the growing reconciliation between the Roman Catholic Church and the Church of England.
